segment.source: About MBAM 2.5 SP1
segment.target: About MBAM 2.5 SP1

segment.source: About MBAM 2.5 SP1
segment.target: About MBAM 2.5 SP1

segment.source: About MBAM 2.5 SP1
segment.target: About MBAM 2.5 SP1

segment.source: MBAM 2.5 SP1 provides a simplified administrative interface for BitLocker Drive Encryption.
segment.target: MBAM 2.5 SP1 provides a simplified administrative interface for BitLocker Drive Encryption.

segment.source: BitLocker offers enhanced protection against data theft or data exposure for computers that are lost or stolen.
segment.target: BitLocker offers enhanced protection against data theft or data exposure for computers that are lost or stolen.

segment.source: BitLocker encrypts all data that is stored on the Windows operating system and drives and configured data drives.
segment.target: BitLocker encrypts all data that is stored on the Windows operating system and drives and configured data drives.

segment.source: Overview of MBAM
segment.target: Overview of MBAM

segment.source: MBAM 2.5 SP1 has the following features:
segment.target: MBAM 2.5 SP1 has the following features:

segment.source: Enables administrators to automate the process of encrypting volumes on client computers across the enterprise.
segment.target: Enables administrators to automate the process of encrypting volumes on client computers across the enterprise.

segment.source: Enables security officers to quickly determine the compliance state of individual computers or even of the enterprise itself.
segment.target: Enables security officers to quickly determine the compliance state of individual computers or even of the enterprise itself.

segment.source: Provides centralized reporting and hardware management with Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager.
segment.target: Provides centralized reporting and hardware management with Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager.

segment.source: Reduces the workload on the Help Desk to assist end users with BitLocker PIN and recovery key requests.
segment.target: Reduces the workload on the Help Desk to assist end users with BitLocker PIN and recovery key requests.

segment.source: Enables end users to recover encrypted devices independently by using the Self-Service Portal.
segment.target: Enables end users to recover encrypted devices independently by using the Self-Service Portal.

segment.source: Enables security officers to easily audit access to recover key information.
segment.target: Enables security officers to easily audit access to recover key information.

segment.source: Empowers Windows Enterprise users to continue working anywhere with the assurance that their corporate data is protected.
segment.target: Empowers Windows Enterprise users to continue working anywhere with the assurance that their corporate data is protected.

segment.source: MBAM enforces the BitLocker encryption policy options that you set for your enterprise, monitors the compliance of client computers with those policies, and reports on the encryption status of the enterprise’s and individual’s computers.
segment.target: MBAM enforces the BitLocker encryption policy options that you set for your enterprise, monitors the compliance of client computers with those policies, and reports on the encryption status of the enterprise’s and individual’s computers.

segment.source: In addition, MBAM lets you access the recovery key information when users forget their PIN or password, or when their BIOS or boot records change.
segment.target: In addition, MBAM lets you access the recovery key information when users forget their PIN or password, or when their BIOS or boot records change.

segment.source: The following groups might be interested in using MBAM to manage BitLocker:
segment.target: The following groups might be interested in using MBAM to manage BitLocker:

segment.source: Administrators, IT security professionals, and compliance officers who are responsible for ensuring that confidential data is not disclosed without authorization
segment.target: Administrators, IT security professionals, and compliance officers who are responsible for ensuring that confidential data is not disclosed without authorization

segment.source: Administrators who are responsible for computer security in remote or branch offices
segment.target: Administrators who are responsible for computer security in remote or branch offices

segment.source: Administrators who are responsible for client computers that are running Windows
segment.target: Administrators who are responsible for client computers that are running Windows

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: BitLocker is not explained in detail in this MBAM documentation.
segment.target: BitLocker is not explained in detail in this MBAM documentation.

segment.source: For more information, see BitLocker Drive Encryption Overview.
segment.target: For more information, see BitLocker Drive Encryption Overview.

segment.source: What’s new in MBAM 2.5 SP1
segment.target: What’s new in MBAM 2.5 SP1

segment.source: This section describes the new features in MBAM 2.5 SP1.
segment.target: This section describes the new features in MBAM 2.5 SP1.

segment.source: Newly Supported Languages for the MBAM 2.5 SP1 Client
segment.target: Newly Supported Languages for the MBAM 2.5 SP1 Client

segment.source: The following additional languages are now supported in MBAM 2.5 SP1 for the MBAM Client only, including the Self-Service Portal:
segment.target: The following additional languages are now supported in MBAM 2.5 SP1 for the MBAM Client only, including the Self-Service Portal:

segment.source: Czech (Czech Republic) cs-CZ
segment.target: Czech (Czech Republic) cs-CZ

segment.source: Danish (Denmark) da-DK
segment.target: Danish (Denmark) da-DK

segment.source: Dutch (Netherlands) nl-NL
segment.target: Dutch (Netherlands) nl-NL

segment.source: Finnish (Finland) fi-FI
segment.target: Finnish (Finland) fi-FI

segment.source: Greek (Greece) el-GR
segment.target: Greek (Greece) el-GR

segment.source: Hungarian (Hungary) hu-HU
segment.target: Hungarian (Hungary) hu-HU

segment.source: Norwegian, Bokmål (Norway) nb-NO
segment.target: Norwegian, Bokmål (Norway) nb-NO

segment.source: Polish (Poland) pl-PL
segment.target: Polish (Poland) pl-PL

segment.source: Portuguese (Portugal) pt-PT
segment.target: Portuguese (Portugal) pt-PT

segment.source: Slovak (Slovakia) sk-SK
segment.target: Slovak (Slovakia) sk-SK

segment.source: Slovenian (Slovenia) sl-SI
segment.target: Slovenian (Slovenia) sl-SI

segment.source: Swedish (Sweden) sv-SE
segment.target: Swedish (Sweden) sv-SE

segment.source: Turkish (Turkey) tr-TR
segment.target: Turkish (Turkey) tr-TR

segment.source: For a list of all languages supported for client and server in MBAM 2.5 and MBAM 2.5 SP1, see MBAM 2.5 Supported Configurations.
segment.target: For a list of all languages supported for client and server in MBAM 2.5 and MBAM 2.5 SP1, see MBAM 2.5 Supported Configurations.

segment.source: Support for Windows 10
segment.target: Support for Windows 10

segment.source: MBAM 2.5 SP1 adds support for Windows 10, in addition to the same software that is supported in earlier versions of MBAM.
segment.target: MBAM 2.5 SP1 adds support for Windows 10, in addition to the same software that is supported in earlier versions of MBAM.

segment.source: Windows 10 is supported in both MBAM 2.5 and MBAM 2.5 SP1.
segment.target: Windows 10 is supported in both MBAM 2.5 and MBAM 2.5 SP1.

segment.source: Support for Microsoft SQL Server 2014 SP1
segment.target: Support for Microsoft SQL Server 2014 SP1

segment.source: MBAM 2.5 SP1 adds support for Microsoft SQL Server 2014 SP1, in addition to the same software that is supported in earlier versions of MBAM.
segment.target: MBAM 2.5 SP1 adds support for Microsoft SQL Server 2014 SP1, in addition to the same software that is supported in earlier versions of MBAM.

segment.source: MBAM no longer ships with separate MSI
segment.target: MBAM no longer ships with separate MSI

segment.source: Beginning in MBAM 2.5 SP1, a separate MSI is no longer included with the MBAM product.
segment.target: Beginning in MBAM 2.5 SP1, a separate MSI is no longer included with the MBAM product.

segment.source: However, you can extract the MSI from the executable file (.exe) that is included with the product.
segment.target: However, you can extract the MSI from the executable file (.exe) that is included with the product.

segment.source: MBAM can escrow OwnerAuth passwords without owning the TPM
segment.target: MBAM can escrow OwnerAuth passwords without owning the TPM

segment.source: Previously, if MBAM did not own the TPM, the TPM OwnerAuth could not be escrowed to the MBAM database.
segment.target: Previously, if MBAM did not own the TPM, the TPM OwnerAuth could not be escrowed to the MBAM database.

segment.source: To configure MBAM to own the TPM and to store the passwords, you had to disable TPM auto-provisioning and clear the TPM on the client computer.
segment.target: To configure MBAM to own the TPM and to store the passwords, you had to disable TPM auto-provisioning and clear the TPM on the client computer.

segment.source: In Windows 8 and higher, MBAM 2.5 SP1 can now escrow the OwnerAuth passwords without owning the TPM.
segment.target: In Windows 8 and higher, MBAM 2.5 SP1 can now escrow the OwnerAuth passwords without owning the TPM.

segment.source: During service startup, MBAM queries to see if the TPM is already owned and if so, it requests the passwords from the operating system.
segment.target: During service startup, MBAM queries to see if the TPM is already owned and if so, it requests the passwords from the operating system.

segment.source: The passwords are then escrowed to the MBAM database.
segment.target: The passwords are then escrowed to the MBAM database.

segment.source: In addition, Group Policy must be set to prevent the OwnerAuth from being deleted locally.
segment.target: In addition, Group Policy must be set to prevent the OwnerAuth from being deleted locally.

segment.source: In Windows 7, MBAM must own the TPM to automatically escrow TPM OwnerAuth information in the MBAM database.
segment.target: In Windows 7, MBAM must own the TPM to automatically escrow TPM OwnerAuth information in the MBAM database.

segment.source: If MBAM does not own the TPM and Active Directory (AD) backup of the TPM is configured through Group Policy, you must use the MBAM Active Directory (AD) Data Import cmdlets to copy TPM OwnerAuth from AD into the MBAM database.
segment.target: If MBAM does not own the TPM and Active Directory (AD) backup of the TPM is configured through Group Policy, you must use the MBAM Active Directory (AD) Data Import cmdlets to copy TPM OwnerAuth from AD into the MBAM database.

segment.source: These are five new PowerShell cmdlets that pre-populate MBAM databases with the Volume recovery and TPM owner information stored in Active Directory.
segment.target: These are five new PowerShell cmdlets that pre-populate MBAM databases with the Volume recovery and TPM owner information stored in Active Directory.

segment.source: For more information, see MBAM 2.5 Security Considerations.
segment.target: For more information, see MBAM 2.5 Security Considerations.

segment.source: MBAM can automatically unlock the TPM after a lockout
segment.target: MBAM can automatically unlock the TPM after a lockout

segment.source: On computers running TPM 1.2, you can now configure MBAM to automatically unlock the TPM in case of a lockout.
segment.target: On computers running TPM 1.2, you can now configure MBAM to automatically unlock the TPM in case of a lockout.

segment.source: If the TPM lockout auto reset feature is enabled, MBAM can detect that a user is locked out and then get the OwnerAuth password from the MBAM database to automatically unlock the TPM for the user.
segment.target: If the TPM lockout auto reset feature is enabled, MBAM can detect that a user is locked out and then get the OwnerAuth password from the MBAM database to automatically unlock the TPM for the user.

segment.source: This feature must be enabled on both the server side and in Group Policy on the client side.
segment.target: This feature must be enabled on both the server side and in Group Policy on the client side.

segment.source: For more information, see MBAM 2.5 Security Considerations.
segment.target: For more information, see MBAM 2.5 Security Considerations.

segment.source: Support for FIPS-compliant BitLocker numerical password protectors
segment.target: Support for FIPS-compliant BitLocker numerical password protectors

segment.source: In MBAM 2.5, support was added for Federal Information Processing Standard (FIPS)-compliant BitLocker recovery keys on devices running the Windows 8.1 operating system.
segment.target: In MBAM 2.5, support was added for Federal Information Processing Standard (FIPS)-compliant BitLocker recovery keys on devices running the Windows 8.1 operating system.

segment.source: However, Windows did not implement FIPS-compliant recovery keys in Windows 7.
segment.target: However, Windows did not implement FIPS-compliant recovery keys in Windows 7.

segment.source: Therefore, Windows 7 and Windows 8 devices still required a Data Recovery Agent (DRA) protector for recovery.
segment.target: Therefore, Windows 7 and Windows 8 devices still required a Data Recovery Agent (DRA) protector for recovery.

segment.source: The Windows team has backported FIPS-compliant recovery keys with a hotfix, and MBAM 2.5 SP1 has added support for them as well.
segment.target: The Windows team has backported FIPS-compliant recovery keys with a hotfix, and MBAM 2.5 SP1 has added support for them as well.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Client computers that are running the Windows 8 operating system still require a DRA protector since the hotfix was not backported to that OS.
segment.target: Client computers that are running the Windows 8 operating system still require a DRA protector since the hotfix was not backported to that OS.

segment.source: See Hotfix Package 2 for BitLocker Administration and Monitoring 2.5 to download and install the BitLocker hotfix for Windows 7 and Windows 8 computers.
segment.target: See Hotfix Package 2 for BitLocker Administration and Monitoring 2.5 to download and install the BitLocker hotfix for Windows 7 and Windows 8 computers.

segment.source: For information about DRA, see Using Data Recovery Agents with BitLocker.
segment.target: For information about DRA, see Using Data Recovery Agents with BitLocker.

segment.source: To enable FIPS compliance in your organization, you must configure the Federal Information Processing Standard (FIPS) Group Policy settings.
segment.target: To enable FIPS compliance in your organization, you must configure the Federal Information Processing Standard (FIPS) Group Policy settings.

segment.source: For configuration instructions, see BitLocker Group Policy Settings.
segment.target: For configuration instructions, see BitLocker Group Policy Settings.

segment.source: Customize pre-boot recovery message and URL with new Group Policy setting
segment.target: Customize pre-boot recovery message and URL with new Group Policy setting

segment.source: A new Group Policy setting, Configure pre-boot recovery message and URL, lets you configure a custom recovery message or specify a URL that is then displayed on the pre-boot BitLocker recovery screen when the OS drive is locked.
segment.target: A new Group Policy setting, Configure pre-boot recovery message and URL, lets you configure a custom recovery message or specify a URL that is then displayed on the pre-boot BitLocker recovery screen when the OS drive is locked.

segment.source: This setting is only available on client computers running Windows 10.
segment.target: This setting is only available on client computers running Windows 10.

segment.source: If you enable this policy setting, you can you can select one of these options for the pre-boot recovery message:
segment.target: If you enable this policy setting, you can you can select one of these options for the pre-boot recovery message:

segment.source: Use custom recovery message: Select this option to include a custom message in the pre-boot BitLocker recovery screen.
segment.target: Use custom recovery message: Select this option to include a custom message in the pre-boot BitLocker recovery screen.

segment.source: Use custom recovery URL: Select this option to replace the default URL that is displayed in the pre-boot BitLocker recovery screen.
segment.target: Use custom recovery URL: Select this option to replace the default URL that is displayed in the pre-boot BitLocker recovery screen.

segment.source: Use default recovery message and URL: Select this option to display the default BitLocker recovery message and URL in the pre-boot BitLocker recovery screen.
segment.target: Use default recovery message and URL: Select this option to display the default BitLocker recovery message and URL in the pre-boot BitLocker recovery screen.

segment.source: If you previously configured a custom recovery message or URL and want to revert to the default message, you must enable this policy and select this option.
segment.target: If you previously configured a custom recovery message or URL and want to revert to the default message, you must enable this policy and select this option.

segment.source: The new Group Policy setting is located in the following GPO node: Computer ConfigurationPoliciesAdministrative TemplatesWindows ComponentsMDOP MBAM (BitLocker Management)Operating System Drive.
segment.target: The new Group Policy setting is located in the following GPO node: Computer ConfigurationPoliciesAdministrative TemplatesWindows ComponentsMDOP MBAM (BitLocker Management)Operating System Drive.

segment.source: For more information, see Planning for MBAM 2.5 Group Policy Requirements.
segment.target: For more information, see Planning for MBAM 2.5 Group Policy Requirements.

segment.source: MBAM added support for Used Space Encryption
segment.target: MBAM added support for Used Space Encryption

segment.source: In MBAM 2.5 SP1, if you enable Used Space Encryption via BitLocker Group Policy, the MBAM Client honors it.
segment.target: In MBAM 2.5 SP1, if you enable Used Space Encryption via BitLocker Group Policy, the MBAM Client honors it.

segment.source: This Group Policy setting is called Enforce drive encryption type on operating system drives and is located in the following GPO node: Computer ConfigurationAdministrative TemplatesWindows ComponentsBitLocker Drive EncryptionOperating System Drives.
segment.target: This Group Policy setting is called Enforce drive encryption type on operating system drives and is located in the following GPO node: Computer ConfigurationAdministrative TemplatesWindows ComponentsBitLocker Drive EncryptionOperating System Drives.

segment.source: If you enable this policy and select the encryption type as Used Space Only encryption, MBAM will honor the policy and BitLocker will only encrypt disk space that is used on the volume.
segment.target: If you enable this policy and select the encryption type as Used Space Only encryption, MBAM will honor the policy and BitLocker will only encrypt disk space that is used on the volume.

segment.source: For more information, see Planning for MBAM 2.5 Group Policy Requirements.
segment.target: For more information, see Planning for MBAM 2.5 Group Policy Requirements.

segment.source: MBAM Client support for Encrypted Hard Drives
segment.target: MBAM Client support for Encrypted Hard Drives

segment.source: MBAM supports BitLocker on Encrypted Hard Drives that meet TCG specification requirements for Opal as well as IEEE 1667 standards.
segment.target: MBAM supports BitLocker on Encrypted Hard Drives that meet TCG specification requirements for Opal as well as IEEE 1667 standards.

segment.source: When BitLocker is enabled on these devices, it will generate keys and perform management functions on the encrypted drive.
segment.target: When BitLocker is enabled on these devices, it will generate keys and perform management functions on the encrypted drive.

segment.source: See Encrypted Hard Drive for more information.
segment.target: See Encrypted Hard Drive for more information.

segment.source: Delegation configuration no longer required when registering SPNs
segment.target: Delegation configuration no longer required when registering SPNs

segment.source: The requirement to configure constrained delegation for SPNs that you register for the application pool account is no longer necessary in MBAM 2.5 SP1.
segment.target: The requirement to configure constrained delegation for SPNs that you register for the application pool account is no longer necessary in MBAM 2.5 SP1.

segment.source: However, it is still a requirement for MBAM 2.5.
segment.target: However, it is still a requirement for MBAM 2.5.

segment.source: Enable BitLocker using MBAM as Part of a Windows Deployment
segment.target: Enable BitLocker using MBAM as Part of a Windows Deployment

segment.source: In MBAM 2.5 SP1, you can use a PowerShell script to configure BitLocker drive encryption and escrow recovery keys to the MBAM Server.
segment.target: In MBAM 2.5 SP1, you can use a PowerShell script to configure BitLocker drive encryption and escrow recovery keys to the MBAM Server.

segment.source: For more information, see How to Enable BitLocker by Using MBAM as Part of a Windows Deployment
segment.target: For more information, see How to Enable BitLocker by Using MBAM as Part of a Windows Deployment

segment.source: Self-Service Portal can be customized by using either PowerShell or the SSP customization wizard
segment.target: Self-Service Portal can be customized by using either PowerShell or the SSP customization wizard

segment.source: As of MBAM 2.5 SP1, the Self-Service Portal can be configured by using the customization wizard as well as by using PowerShell.
segment.target: As of MBAM 2.5 SP1, the Self-Service Portal can be configured by using the customization wizard as well as by using PowerShell.

segment.source: See How to Configure the MBAM 2.5 Web Applications.
segment.target: See How to Configure the MBAM 2.5 Web Applications.

segment.source: Web browser no longer unintentionally runs as administrator
segment.target: Web browser no longer unintentionally runs as administrator

segment.source: An issue in MBAM 2.5 caused help links in the Server Configuration tool to cause browser windows to open with administrator rights.
segment.target: An issue in MBAM 2.5 caused help links in the Server Configuration tool to cause browser windows to open with administrator rights.

segment.source: This issue is fixed in MBAM 2.5 SP1.
segment.target: This issue is fixed in MBAM 2.5 SP1.

segment.source: No longer need to download the JavaScript files to configure the Self-Service Portal when the CDN is inaccessible
segment.target: No longer need to download the JavaScript files to configure the Self-Service Portal when the CDN is inaccessible

segment.source: In MBAM 2.5 and earlier, the jQuery files used for configuration of the Self-Service Portal had to be downloaded from the CDN in advance if clients accessing the Self-Service Portal did not have internet access.
segment.target: In MBAM 2.5 and earlier, the jQuery files used for configuration of the Self-Service Portal had to be downloaded from the CDN in advance if clients accessing the Self-Service Portal did not have internet access.

segment.source: In MBAM 2.5 SP1, all JavaScript files are included in the product, so downloading them is unnecessary.
segment.target: In MBAM 2.5 SP1, all JavaScript files are included in the product, so downloading them is unnecessary.

segment.source: Reports can be opened in Report Builder 3.0
segment.target: Reports can be opened in Report Builder 3.0

segment.source: In MBAM 2.5 SP1, the reports have been updated to the latest report definition language schema, allowing users to open and customize the reports in Report Builder 3.0 and save them immediately without corrupting the report file.
segment.target: In MBAM 2.5 SP1, the reports have been updated to the latest report definition language schema, allowing users to open and customize the reports in Report Builder 3.0 and save them immediately without corrupting the report file.

segment.source: New PowerShell cmdlets
segment.target: New PowerShell cmdlets

segment.source: New PowerShell cmdlets for MBAM 2.5 SP1 enable you to configure and manage different MBAM features, including databases, reports, and web applications.
segment.target: New PowerShell cmdlets for MBAM 2.5 SP1 enable you to configure and manage different MBAM features, including databases, reports, and web applications.

segment.source: Each feature has a corresponding PowerShell cmdlet that you can use to enable or disable features, or to get information about the feature.
segment.target: Each feature has a corresponding PowerShell cmdlet that you can use to enable or disable features, or to get information about the feature.

segment.source: The following cmdlets have been implemented for MBAM 2.5 SP1:
segment.target: The following cmdlets have been implemented for MBAM 2.5 SP1:

segment.source: Write-MbamTpmInformation
segment.target: Write-MbamTpmInformation

segment.source: Write-MbamRecoveryInformation
segment.target: Write-MbamRecoveryInformation

segment.source: Read-ADTpmInformation
segment.target: Read-ADTpmInformation

segment.source: Read-ADRecoveryInformation
segment.target: Read-ADRecoveryInformation

segment.source: Write-MbamComputerUser
segment.target: Write-MbamComputerUser

segment.source: The following parameters have been implemented in the Enable-MbamWebApplication and Test-MbamWebApplication cmdlets for MBAM 2.5 SP1:
segment.target: The following parameters have been implemented in the Enable-MbamWebApplication and Test-MbamWebApplication cmdlets for MBAM 2.5 SP1:

segment.source: DataMigrationAccessGroup
segment.target: DataMigrationAccessGroup

segment.source: TpmAutoUnlock
segment.target: TpmAutoUnlock

segment.source: For information about the cmdlets, see MBAM 2.5 Security Considerations and Microsoft Bitlocker Administration and Monitoring Cmdlet Help.
segment.target: For information about the cmdlets, see MBAM 2.5 Security Considerations and Microsoft Bitlocker Administration and Monitoring Cmdlet Help.

segment.source: MBAM agent detects presentation mode
segment.target: MBAM agent detects presentation mode

segment.source: The MBAM agent can detect when the computer is in presentation mode and avoid invoking the MBAM UI at that time.
segment.target: The MBAM agent can detect when the computer is in presentation mode and avoid invoking the MBAM UI at that time.

segment.source: MBAM agent service now configured to use delayed start
segment.target: MBAM agent service now configured to use delayed start

segment.source: After installation, the service will now set the MBAM agent service to use delayed start, decreasing the amount of time it takes to start Windows.
segment.target: After installation, the service will now set the MBAM agent service to use delayed start, decreasing the amount of time it takes to start Windows.

segment.source: Locked Fixed Data volumes now report as Compliant
segment.target: Locked Fixed Data volumes now report as Compliant

segment.source: The compliance calculation logic for "Locked Fixed Data" volumes has been changed to report the volumes as "Compliant," but with a Protector State and Encryption State of "Unknown" and with a Compliance Status Detail of "Volume is locked".
segment.target: The compliance calculation logic for "Locked Fixed Data" volumes has been changed to report the volumes as "Compliant," but with a Protector State and Encryption State of "Unknown" and with a Compliance Status Detail of "Volume is locked".

segment.source: Previously, locked volumes were reported as “Non-Compliant”, a Protector State of "Encrypted", an Encryption State of "Unknown", and a Compliance Status Detail of "An unknown error".
segment.target: Previously, locked volumes were reported as “Non-Compliant”, a Protector State of "Encrypted", an Encryption State of "Unknown", and a Compliance Status Detail of "An unknown error".

segment.source: How to Get MDOP Technologies
segment.target: How to Get MDOP Technologies

segment.source: MBAM is a part of the Microsoft Desktop Optimization Pack (MDOP).
segment.target: MBAM is a part of the Microsoft Desktop Optimization Pack (MDOP).

segment.source: MDOP is part of the Microsoft Software Assurance program.
segment.target: MDOP is part of the Microsoft Software Assurance program.

segment.source: For more information about the Microsoft Software Assurance program and how to acquire the MDOP, see How Do I Get MDOP?.
segment.target: For more information about the Microsoft Software Assurance program and how to acquire the MDOP, see How Do I Get MDOP?.

segment.source: MBAM 2.5 SP1 Release Notes
segment.target: MBAM 2.5 SP1 Release Notes

segment.source: For more information and late-breaking news that is not included in this documentation, see Release Notes for MBAM 2.5 SP1.
segment.target: For more information and late-breaking news that is not included in this documentation, see Release Notes for MBAM 2.5 SP1.

segment.target: Got a suggestion for MBAM?

segment.target: For MBAM issues, use the MBAM TechNet Forum.
